intro: Coristospermum seguieri, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, spiny capsules that contain seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various animals.
